post_text: Update: Due to the recent water testing throughout the Northmont City School District, there will be two actions taken at Englewood Elementary: We will remove water lines that are not used on a regular basis to prevent water issues in the future; and we will also chlorinate the water system after the plumbing changes are completed. The district is confident after working with the City of Englewood Water Department, Public Health and the EPA that this plan will allow the water in the building to be used for all functions again, which we will verify with a final round of conclusive testing. We are working to establish dates for the work to be performed and we will have the issues resolved soon. In addition to these immediate action steps, the district is also implementing an ongoing maintenance plan for each building, provided through the guidance of the above-mentioned departments, consisting of regular flushing of all water lines.

Northmont City Schools will deliver food for students Friday March 20, Tuesday March 24, and Thursday March 26 using transportation routes. We will reassess after Spring Break based on the Governor’s decisions going forward.
Morning bus routes will run at their normal times and food will be delivered to students at those bus stops. For students who normally walk, are driven to school OR miss the bus stop delivery, food will be distributed outside the student’s assigned school building for 30 minutes during normal morning drop off times on March 20, 24 and 26th. Thank you for your continued patience as we work through this scenario.

Per an order from the Governor of the State of Ohio, all K-12 schools will be closed from Monday, March 16 until April 3.
Northmont students and staff will report tomorrow, March 13, to work on the remote education plans for all students. Second through 5th grade students will be bringing home their iPads and chargers tomorrow at the end of the school day. Beginning Wednesday, March 18, students will work from home on lessons provided by their teachers via Google Classroom or other web-based options.
All events and extra-curricular activities are suspended beginning this evening, Thursday, March 12th through Friday, April 3rd. The district will reassess with guidance from the Montgomery County Health Department and we will continue to work with them to make decisions beyond April 3, 2020.
This is a fluid situation that is subject to change.
Refer to the www.northmontschools.net for continual updates and instructions.

While this is usually an honor reserved for volunteers in the district, it was noted by Superintendent Thomas how often Officer Hacker has responded to calls, texts, and emails during his time off.

Great job, Officer Hacker, and thanks for being an awesome School Resource Officer!

So far, we have found homes for about half of the students, and are still looking for homes for:

post_text: Northmont High School will be offering the PSAT/NMSQT for junior students on Wednesday, October 16 at 7:45 a.m. at Northmont High School. The PSAT/NMSQT is the best practice for the SAT exam as well as the qualifying test for the National Merit Scholarship Competition. If interested, register in the Counseling Center/Main Office of the High School with Mrs. Adams. Registration open now through October 11. The cost of the exam is $17 cash or check made payable to Northmont High School. This test is for junior students only. Register soon as there is limited seating! If you have any questions, please contact your counselor.
